pageContext.desc: From a Chicago wig maker to a customer in Iowa.

pages.transcription:
Mason City
1 -9 -1884
Miss Wilson
Dear Friend
Your kind letter received to
day many thanks for enclosed
note or another order. but you
cannot alter the note when
you come as you must not
be kept waiting a whole
year six months will suit
me better but I will try my
best to settle it in less time
you must not expect me
to impose upon your kind
-ness that lenght [sic] of time.
and yet "dear friend" what

sink of the stove with a fire in it and a good fire
at that
Oh I forgot I owe your Papa I think $2.00 
for coal will you kindly say to him that I will 
send it to him as soon as possible if he will 
make out the Bill as I am not quite sure wether [sic]
it is that or more
Hoping to see you soon with 
love from all
Your Truly
Addie L Contrelli
PS
Your braid I will 
make into two braids I think
I know the shade & will have it done when you come
PS I have taken in two small orders to
day the first (blood)

should I have done only for 
your kindness.  You say in 
your letter that some day 
you may have to call upon
me.  I truly hope that "day 
will never come" but if "it ever 
should remember" dear girl" 
I will share my last cent 
with you if I am no better 
off than I am now, and should 
I be placed in better circum 
stances remember that you 
must call upon me for what 
ever you want no matter where 
I am.
I am so glad that you 
are feeling quite well again 
but do not try to do anything 
untill [sic] you are quite strong then 
you will be able to get through 
without any draw back
In reference

to your Mamma's braid I think 
after it has been well moist 
with the natural moisture from 
the head it will be quite smooth 
should it not I will make 
another  You know that there 
is some gradation of hair in all 
shades that are not as moist 
as others & that hair may be like 
that should it prove so I will 
surely make another.
I must now 
close & go to bed I am not 
feeling well I think that I 
must have taken a heavy cold 
my bones all ache they say here that 
it was 38 below zero here [crossed out] on Friday 
& Saturday I know that the water 
froze in the pail right at the

Chicago Oct 22d 1883
Miss Wilson
Dear friend 
I received both letters quite 
safe & thank you oh so much 
for your kindness 
I went about town to 
day & got the Hair for 
your friends weave will 
work on it to morrow 
& send it [   ] from
[  ] on Wednesday & 
will send your Mammas 
braid Thursday or Friday I 
had to get a little more hair 
for it to day for fear of keep-
ing your friend waiting will

leave your tress untill [sic] I
have sent the weave. I 
will leave here about Oct 
the 30th for Algona
Dear Friend
The person 
that you have engaged
the room from for me
will you kindly tell her 
that I have Bed linens,
Blankets, Bolster & Pillows & 
Table linens so that she 
will not go to any extra
expence [sic]
Miss Wilson are
their any commissions that
I can perform for you while 
here if so I should be happy 
to do them
I must now say
good night. I will do all
all in my power to please

you & your friends to the 
best of my ability
Respectfully yours
A L Contrelli

Chicago Oct 1st 1883
Miss Wilson
Dear Friend
Your kind letter came duly to 
hand on Friday morning 
but I did not get home untill [sic] 
Saturday night.
I will do my very 
best to please your friend 
I think I can make her a 
wave which will be just 
what she wants & will send 
'it' to her on Saturday morning 
her part is a very steep one & 
it will take me a day longer 
to make it
Kind friend things have 
been very dull so I have found 
it better for me to go out of the

city to canvass I was getting 
along very nicely & had $16.00 
saved up to buy Hair goods 
with so that I could come 
to Algona but last Thursday 
week I lost all hand bag as 
well with papers in the pockets 
also a pocket piecing of silver 1833 
it seems as if nothing but 
bad luck has attended me 
for some time since your 
kind offer I felt as if I should 
so much like to come to your 
town but felt as if I should 
not impose on your good 
& kind offer to pay my way I 
thought that if I could 
earn & save about $30.00 I 
could by taking a few lessons 
in curling & cleaning feathers 
I could or would rather 
be able to make a living with 
[  ] the [  ] that amount

I think I could get a few 
dollars more of your goods so 
that it would have enabled 
me to start in a small way 
thus you see it would not 
have left me very much in 
debt as it worries me so 
if I owe anything.  Still I 
will try & keep up for two 
or three weeks longer & see 
if I can make up what I 
have lost & in the mean 
times perhaps I will have 
George settled for the winter 
I have not heard from 
the gentleman that I wrote 
about but went yesterday 
to see Bishop Feehan himself 
but he was not at home I 
will go again to morrow 
perhaps with better success 
I hope for Birdies sake 
that every thing will

come out all right say 
being away from home 
compels her to remain at 
home & to loose her schooling 
& alas make her unhappy
Kind friend I will 
do my best both in regard 
to your Mammas & friends 
work I must now close 
as I must be at Hyde Park 
by 2 OClock to shampoo a head
With kind regards from
Your Respectfully
Mrs A L Contrelli
276 Randolph
PS I have advertised for the 
bag but with no success.
Never carry a bag with a 
strap across your shoulder

Chicago 8/29th 1883
Miss Wilson
Dear Madam
Your letter just received
I haveÂ ? been able to leave the city
of money I am very sorry as regards the braid

AT ONCE, IF I COULD LIKE TO MAKE IT CONNECT AT ONCE.

 IF I COULD GET A FREE PASS TO MASON CITY, I WOULD COME RIGHT ON AND TAKE A PART OF A STORE AS A ROOM AND WORK MY WAY UP, BUT EVERYTHING IS VERY DULL HERE AND A PERSON CANNOT START HERE IN BUSINESS THEY HAVE MONEY IF THERE ARE NO DRY GOODS AS FANCY STORES THAT KEEP THEIRS. I KNOW I COULD MAKE A LIVING FOR BIRDIE AND MYSELF.

PLEASE BE KIND UNCLE TO SEND SWITCH AT ONCE AND I WILL MAKE IT. JUST THE SHADES OF SAMPLES. YOU SEND BUT IF YOU WILL LOOK ON THE SWITCH YOU WILL FIND

THE SAME SAMPLE THAT YOU GAVE ME BEFORE. 

 HOPING TO HEAR FROM YOU SOON. CLOSING RESPECTFULLY, MRS CONTRELLE

P.S. YOU HAD BETTER SEND LETTER TO POST OFFICE AND I WILL CALL THERE FOR IT, SO I SHALL NOT BE HERE AT THIS HOUSE AFTER THIS WEEK. OH HOW I WISH I WAS SETTLED AT JEAN'S AS IF I ONLY HAD A SISTER LIKE YOU TO CONFIDE IN I SHOULD BE AS HAPPY, BUT HAVING NO ONE MAKES ME FEEL AS IF I SHOULD GO OUT OF MY MIND AT TIMES IF I WAS A WOMAN THAT HAD NO RESPECT FOR MY CHILDREN OR MYSELF I WOULD NOT FIND FAULT LATER AGE

Dear Miss Wilson
I could not sleep last night 
thinking it seems so
if I must go to Mason City
so my last and only plan is will be to go
on Monday night
and see about the store
and my page ok?
I have it ready by January 5th
by that time I can work up what orders I have
and perhaps be able to take some over with me last night.
after coming home i figured up what it would 
cost me to stay here and take a store and
fix it up would be living

rent: and fix my order for one month 53.00 to go to Mason City- about 56.00 to stay where I am as the month is almost gone about quarter the above as the Rent-A-Car will be taken out in work so it will only be our living, and perhaps I may be able to take in some orders on Monday in Mason City. That is if you will finally let Birdie stay with you Monday night. Just as soon as I would think about staying here till spring I could not go to sleep but just as soon as I had made up my Mind Regarding the above I went to sleep but very near morning. in Ligh Respectfully, Addie Cantrelle

Miss. L.E.Wilson
Present 
To Lenette E Wilson
Alqona Iowa
